metadata.title: Year Class Abundance and Recruitment in Walleye Pollock, Theragra chalcogramma, in the West Bering Sea

creators.name: Kamchatka Div., Pac. Res. Inst. Fish.

metadata.description:
Details are given of the use of virtual population analysis to estimate the stocks
     of the West Bering Sea Pollock (Theragra chalcogramma). Data regarding
     year class abundance for the years 1966-84 and recruitment from 1973-88
     are presented. The total abundance of the Pollock population was found to be
     the main influence on the strength of the year class; environmental factors have
     little effect on the abundance of year classes, although more favorable
     reproductive conditions are found in years with warmer water temperature.
     Recruitment to the fishery occurs primarily at ages 2-4 and varies from 0.9 to
     5.9 million fish; on average the ratio of recruits of the rest of the stock is 1:1.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To show the year class abundance and recruitment in walleye Pollock, Theragra chalcogramma, in the West Bering Sea
